review: As a Prime member this is a perfect addition for me. Lots of free programs to watch when there's not much on my cable to watch. Setup was fairly easy and connectivity to my internet was a little sluggish, but finally connected. I have 50Mb speed and the Fire TV stick was only about 5 feet from the router. It has dropped off a couple of times with minimal impact to what I was watching. It takes a little getting used to with pulling the apps I wanted and getting them setup. Fortunately, I have experience from using mu Roku box. I like the idea of having a remote with the unit. Unlike Chromecast. I also like being able to connect my Kindle Fire HDX. Although the picture quality isn't as good as I'd like. Picture quality using the Fire TV stick apps is excellent. The HBO Go and ShowTime Anytime apps are available on the Fire TV stick now. I noticed others complained about not having them available. You do need those channels on your cable or satellite service though. I have 5 TVs in my house with only 3 connected to cable through DVRs or a box. The other two only have OTA antennas, so I get my local stations. With the Fire TV stick I can now see HBO, Showtime, ESPN channels, as well as other stations not found OTA. Basically, this works great for my needs.
